intro: Brachycorythis galeandra, commonly known as the Cape fumitory, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The botanical features of Brachycorythis galeandra make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
